title: Shaykh Ali Khan Zanganeh
text:
Shaykh Ali Khan Zanganeh (, died 1689), was an <a href="Iranian%20peoples">Iranian</a> statesman of <a href="Kurdish%20people">Kurdish</a> origin, who served as the <a href="List%20of%20Safavid%20Grand%20Viziers">grand vizier</a> of the <a href="Safavid">Safavid</a> king ("<a href="shah">shah</a>") <a href="Suleiman%20I%20of%20Persia">Suleiman I</a> (r. 1666–1694) from 1669 to 1689. Due to his efforts in reforming the declining Iranian economy, he has been called the "Safavid <a href="Amir%20Kabir">Amir Kabir</a>" in modern historiography.
Family.
A native of the <a href="Kermanshah%20Province">Kermanshah Province</a>, Shaykh Ali Khan was the son of <a href="Ali%20Beg%20Zanganeh">Ali Beg Zanganeh</a>, and belonged to the <a href="Zanganeh%20%28tribe%29">Zanganeh</a> tribe, a <a href="Sunni%20Islam">Sunni</a> Kurdish tribe, which was part of the <a href="Qizilbash">Qizilbash</a>. Shaykh Ali Khan had two brothers named <a href="Najaf%20Qoli%20Beg%20Zanganeh">Najaf Qoli Beg Zanganeh</a> and <a href="Shahrokh%20Sultan%20Zanganeh">Shahrokh Sultan Zanganeh</a> and also had several sons, whom were: <a href="Hossein%20Ali%20Khan%20Zanganeh">Hossein Ali Khan Zanganeh</a>, <a href="Suleiman%20Khan%20Zanganeh">Suleiman Khan Zanganeh</a>, <a href="Ismail%20Beg%20Zanganeh">Ismail Beg Zanganeh</a>, <a href="Abbas%20Beg%20Zanganeh">Abbas Beg Zanganeh</a>, <a href="Abbas%20Qoli%20Beg%20Zanganeh">Abbas Qoli Beg Zanganeh</a>, and the most prominent one being <a href="Shahqoli%20Khan%20Zanganeh">Shahqoli Khan Zanganeh</a>, who would also later serve as grand vizier of the country.
Biography.
Shaykh Ali Khan's destiny is similar to that of many other Iranian grand viziers—from <a href="Hasanak%20the%20Vizier">Hasanak</a> under the <a href="Ghaznavids">Ghaznavids</a> to <a href="Amir%20Kabir">Amir Kabir</a> under the <a href="Qajar%20dynasty">Qajars</a>—and is owing, in an established sense, to the ambivalence of the grand vizier's position in the Iranian bureaucratic practice.
Shaykh Ali Khan served as the commander of the empire's <a href="musketeer">musketeer</a> corps ("<a href="tofangchi-aghasi">tofangchi-aghasi</a>") from 1668 till June 1669.
